alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jewell, northeastern Smith and southeastern Webster Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 830 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Red Cloud, or 41 miles northwest of Beloit, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burr Oak and Esbon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
